title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 650.1 - Use of bridges conditional
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 650.1 - Use of bridges conditional

State Regulations

The use of the bridges by any vehicle, pedestrian or other
form of traffic shall be, and shall be deemed to be, conditioned upon payment
of the prescribed tolls and upon the observance of the rules and regulations
set forth in this Chapter; all rights, privileges, licenses and permits, expressed or implied, for the use of said bridges by any vehicle, pedestrian or
other form of traffic, granted by the commission, shall be, and shall be deemed
to be revocable; and each such right, privilege, license or permit shall at the
option of the commission be, and be deemed to be, revoked and cancelled by and
upon the breach of any rule or regulation or of the violation while in or upon
the said bridges of any applicable laws or ordinances. Vehicles violating any
of the rules and regulations set forth in this Chapter, as well as other
vehicles owned or operated by the owner and/or operator of such vehicle, may be
excluded from the bridges, permanently or for a specified
time. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes

650.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
